definition: to close (a door)/to eclipse/muddled/stupid/ignorant/variant of 暗[an4]

road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)

sentences.english: Rumors have it that secret tunnels lead out of this castle, but we haven't found any.
sentences.chinese: 传说这座古堡里面有条暗道，可我们还没找到。

definition: hidden smile/smirk/to rejoice covertly/secret satisfaction concerning one's evil plans
to laugh involuntarily/Taiwan pr. [e4 ran2 shi1 xiao4]
to laugh in spite of oneself/to be unable to help laughing/to break into laughter
to have heard what was said
to force a smile/a bitter laugh
to sneer/to laugh grimly/grin of dissatisfaction (bitterness, helplessness, indignation etc)/bitter, grim, sarcastic or angry smile
to whine about hardships/to complain of one's bitter lot/to complain/to grumble
